meanings.definition: To make a loophole or loopholes in.

meanings.sent2: She loopholed the system to avoid paying taxes.
meanings.sent3: The student loopholed the test, finding a way to cheat.
meanings.sent4: They loopholed the rules, bending them to their advantage.
meanings.sent5: The lawyer loopholed the contract, finding a way to escape.

meanings.definition: To exploit a loophole or loopholes.
